title: Israeli Strike Hits Beirut's Southern Suburbs: Security Source
content: An Israeli strike hit Beirut's southern suburbs late on Monday, a security source said, with a Reuters reporter seeing a flash of light and hearing a loud blast.
summary: An Israeli strike hit Beirut's southern suburbs late on Monday, a security source said, with a Reuters reporter seeing a flash of light and hearing a loud blast.

title: Another Hezbollah Commander Killed In Israeli Airstrike
content: In a targeted airstrike on Saturday, the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) struck Beirut, resulting in the death of Eid Hassan Nashar, a high-ranking commander of Hezbollah's Medium-Range Rocket Unit.
summary: In a targeted airstrike on Saturday, the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) struck Beirut, resulting in the death of Eid Hassan Nashar, a high-ranking commander of Hezbollah's Medium-Range Rocket Unit.

title: Israel Informs US Of 'Limited Ground Op' Against Hezbollah In Lebanon
content: Israel has told the United States it is conducting limited ground operations focused on Hezbollah infrastructure in Lebanon near the border with Israel, the State Department said on Monday.
summary: Israel has told the United States it is conducting limited ground operations focused on Hezbollah infrastructure in Lebanon near the border with Israel, the State Department said on Monday.

title: Biden Calls For Ceasefire In Lebanon But Israeli Incursion Seems Imminent
content: US President Joe Biden called for a ceasefire in Lebanon on Monday but a US official said Israeli troop deployments suggested a ground incursion against Hezbollah militants could be imminent.
summary: US President Joe Biden called for a ceasefire in Lebanon on Monday but a US official said Israeli troop deployments suggested a ground incursion against Hezbollah militants could be imminent.

title: A List Of Important Dates In 2024 US Presidential Election
content: Republican former President Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris, a Democrat, will face each other in the November 5 US presidential election.
summary: Republican former President Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris, a Democrat, will face each other in the November 5 US presidential election.

title: Scientists Explain Mount Everest's 'More Than Expected' Growth
content: Mount Everest is Earth's tallest mountain - towering 5.5 miles (8.85 km) above sea level - and is still growing.
summary: Mount Everest is Earth's tallest mountain - towering 5.5 miles (8.85 km) above sea level - and is still growing.

title: "Nowhere In Middle East Israel Cannot Reach": Netanyahu Warns Iran
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu issued a fresh warning to Iran Monday, saying there was no place in the Middle East beyond Israel's reach amid a flurry of strikes against Hezbollah in Lebanon.
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu issued a fresh warning to Iran Monday, saying there was no place in the Middle East beyond Israel's reach amid a flurry of strikes against Hezbollah in Lebanon.

title: Hezbollah Vows To Keep Fighting Israel After Nasrallah's Killing In Strikes
content: Hezbollah vowed on Monday to keep fighting Israel and said it was ready to face any ground operation into Lebanon, after its leader was killed in an air strike that dealt the group a seismic blow.
summary: Hezbollah vowed on Monday to keep fighting Israel and said it was ready to face any ground operation into Lebanon, after its leader was killed in an air strike that dealt the group a seismic blow.

title: India Issues Helpline Numbers For Citizens Stranded In Nepal Floods
content: India on Monday issued helpline numbers for its citizens stranded in Nepal due to floods and landslides during the past few days.
summary: India on Monday issued helpline numbers for its citizens stranded in Nepal due to floods and landslides during the past few days.

title: "Only Patriotic Choice": NYT Endorses Kamala Harris For President
content: The New York Times editorial board on Monday endorsed Kamala Harris, calling the Democrat "the only patriotic choice for president" in the race against Republican Donald Trump.
summary: The New York Times editorial board on Monday endorsed Kamala Harris, calling the Democrat "the only patriotic choice for president" in the race against Republican Donald Trump.

title: FBI To Pay $22.6 Million To Settle Women Trainees' Sex Bias Lawsuit
content: The U.S. Department of Justice has agreed to pay $22.6 million to settle a lawsuit by 34 women who claim they were wrongly dismissed from the FBI's agent training academy because of their sex.
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice has agreed to pay $22.6 million to settle a lawsuit by 34 women who claim they were wrongly dismissed from the FBI's agent training academy because of their sex.

title: "Borders Drawn By Politicians": When Diljit Dosanjh Met Fan From Pakistan
content: A heartwarming gesture by popular Punjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh has been winning hearts. He met one of his fans during his "Dil-luminati Tour" in Manchester and gifted her a box of shoes.
summary: A heartwarming gesture by popular Punjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh has been winning hearts. He met one of his fans during his "Dil-luminati Tour" in Manchester and gifted her a box of shoes.

title: Two-Thirds Of Buildings In Gaza Damaged Since War Began Last Year: UN
content: Two-thirds of the buildings in the Gaza Strip have been damaged or destroyed since the Gaza war began in October 2023, the United Nations said on Monday.
summary: Two-thirds of the buildings in the Gaza Strip have been damaged or destroyed since the Gaza war began in October 2023, the United Nations said on Monday.

title: Cash-Strapped Sri Lanka Records First Deflation Since 1995
content: Cash-strapped Sri Lanka's economy recorded falling consumer prices for the first time in 29 years, official data showed Monday, with the September inflation figure dipping to negative 0.5 per cent.
summary: Cash-strapped Sri Lanka's economy recorded falling consumer prices for the first time in 29 years, official data showed Monday, with the September inflation figure dipping to negative 0.5 per cent.

title: Lebanon PM Calls For Ceasefire With Israel As Strikes Intensify
content: Lebanon's Prime Minister Najib Mikati on Monday called for a ceasefire in the fighting between Israel and Hezbollah during a meeting with French Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot in Beirut.
summary: Lebanon's Prime Minister Najib Mikati on Monday called for a ceasefire in the fighting between Israel and Hezbollah during a meeting with French Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot in Beirut.

title: Putin Vows To Achieve All "Goals" In Ukraine As Russia Claims New Ground
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin vowed Monday to achieve all his "goals" in Ukraine and celebrated the second anniversary of annexing four Ukrainian regions, as his army claimed fresh advances in the conflict.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin vowed Monday to achieve all his "goals" in Ukraine and celebrated the second anniversary of annexing four Ukrainian regions, as his army claimed fresh advances in the conflict.

title: "One In A Million": China Woman With 2 Uteruses Delivers A Baby From Each
content: The condition known as uterus didelphys affects only 0.3% of women worldwide.
summary: The condition known as uterus didelphys affects only 0.3% of women worldwide.

title: Solar Eclipse On October 2: How Fast It Will Travel
content: The much-anticipated annular solar eclipse is set to grace the skies on October 2. The eclipse will begin at 9:13 pm IST on October 2 and conclude at 3:17 pm IST the next day.
summary: The much-anticipated annular solar eclipse is set to grace the skies on October 2. The eclipse will begin at 9:13 pm IST on October 2 and conclude at 3:17 pm IST the next day.

title: 200 Killed In Floods, Landslides In Nepal, Rescue Operations Continue
content: Search and rescue operations continued in Nepal for the third consecutive day on Monday after monsoon-induced floods and landslides killed more than 200 people in one of the worst rain-related disasters in the Himalayan nation in recent years.
summary: Search and rescue operations continued in Nepal for the third consecutive day on Monday after monsoon-induced floods and landslides killed more than 200 people in one of the worst rain-related disasters in the Himalayan nation in recent years.

title: Tesla Catches Fire Inside Florida Garage Flooded From Hurricane Helene
content: Officials advised people not to charge, drive, or store their EVs or E-bikes in their homes or garages.
summary: Officials advised people not to charge, drive, or store their EVs or E-bikes in their homes or garages.
